The 11th iteration of the annual cloud conference saw more than 50,000 partners and customers descend on Las Vegas in person, accompanied by more than 300,000 remote attendees. The world is asynchronous. The world is event-driven. â€” Dr. Werner Vogels, CTO, Amazon.com It required a world stage to propagate asynchrony and event-driven architecture in our modern era of cloud computing.

item.title: Recap of AWS re:Invent 2022 - Data & Analytics Highlights ðŸ“œ
item.description: Recap of AWS re:Invent 2022 - Data & Analytics Highlights Overview AWS re:Invent 2022 is in the bag! The 11th iteration of the annual cloud conference saw more than 50,000 partners and customers descend on Las Vegas in person, accompanied by more than 300,000 remote attendees. The event featured excellent keynote speakers, product announcements, training and certification opportunities, hands-on technical sessions, and more. I was thrilled to witness all of the fun, fully embracing AWS CEO Adam Selipsky’s message that now is the perfect time to “lean in harder” to help clients accelerate their journey to the cloud.
